snippet: German authorities, trying to speed the identification of some of 1,400 works apparently lost during the Nazi era, said that they would soon begin posting information online.
abstract: German authorities, trying to speed identification of some 1,400 works apparently lost during Nazi era, say they will begin posting information on 590 of those with questionable provenances on Web site lostart.de, database of art looted or missing since World War II.

byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and PATRICIA COHEN

lead_paragraph: German authorities, trying to speed the identification of some of 1,400 works apparently lost during the Nazi era, said that they would soon begin posting information online.

headline.print_headline: Information on Art Trove To Start Going Online
headline.main: Information on Art Trove to Start Going Online
